keyTakeAways: Amazon Web Services experienced a massive outage on Monday, disrupting internet services reliant on its cloud platform.
The US has made strategic moves to restrict Chinaâ€™s access to semiconductor technology, raising concerns about global tech supply chains and innovation.
A three-part series on climate change highlights the realities of environmental degradation and presents innovative solutions for future sustainability.
Social media influencers misused algorithmic results to spread misinformation, demonstrating vulnerabilities in digital platforms and public trust.
A new transparency law in the US, while praised by experts, is considered 'light touch' regulation and may lack sufficient enforcement.
A strategic move by a company in advance of new trade talks with the US indicates growing geopolitical tension in technology and manufacturing sectors.
Omar M. Yaghi, a chemist born to Palestinian refugee parents in Jordan, has been awarded a Nobel Prize, highlighting achievements in science from diverse global backgrounds.
An electric carmaker launched a new model to counter slumping sales, reflecting industry challenges in consumer demand and market competition.
The ChatGPT creator has been granted an option to buy up to 10 percent of AMD, signaling potential shifts in AI and semiconductor ownership dynamics.
Advances in AI-generated deepfake audio could lead to a significant increase in phone call fraud, posing new security and ethical challenges.
The Nobel Prize in Medicine was announced on Monday, followed by five additional prizes to be announced over the next week, signaling global recognition of scientific breakthroughs.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The article covers a range of critical developments in science and technology, including a major AWS outage highlighting digital infrastructure fragility, US-China semiconductor tensions, misinformation spread via social media influencers, and the growing risks of AI-generated deepfakes in fraud. It also features scientific recognition, such as Nobel Prize winner Omar M. Yaghi, and industry responses like a new electric car model to combat falling sales. Additionally, strategic technology deals and policy developments, such as a US transparency law and potential AI-hardware investments, are highlighted, reflecting the dynamic and often volatile nature of global tech innovation and regulation.
title: Science and Technology | Today's latest from Al Jazeera
